newsitem.title: INDIA: Rajiv Gandhi's widow joins India Congress-deputies.
newsitem.headline: Rajiv Gandhi's widow joins India Congress-deputies.

text.p: Sonia Gandhi, the Italian-born widow of former Indian prime minister Rajiv Gandhi, has decided to join his Congress party after refusing membership for years, members of parliament said on Thursday.
"Mrs Gandhi has decided to join the Indian National Congress, accepting the membership," Priya Ranjan Dasmunshi, a member of the lower house of parliament, told Reuters in the Indian capital.
Neither Sonia Gandhi nor her spokesman could be reached for comment.
Rajiv Gandhi was killed by a suicide bomber in May 1991. His mother, Indira Gandhi, served as prime minister from 1966 to 1977 and again from 1980 to 1984 before she was assassinated.

Sonia Gandhi has led a reclusive life since her husband's assassination, but she yields important influence within Congress, whose leaders regularly seek her support in the party's periodic factional battles.

The current party president, Sitaram Kesri, has been keen to see her play a more active and public role in the politics of the party, which suffered its worst ever defeat in general elections last year.
